title: What Do You Believe?
description: Join a fun, guided exploration of inner space with music & art as we create our own gallery of humanity. Start time: 4:20pm. All materials provided.
print_description: Join a fun, guided exploration of inner space with music & art as we create our own gallery of humanity. Start time: 4:20pm. All materials provided.

title: WE: Web of experiences
description: The WEB OF EXPERIENCES (WE) is a web of ropes and light strings that invites all passers-by to share a piece of themselves--knowledge, art, thoughts, or an experience. All passers-by and visitors will feel inspired (and be asked) to contribute to WE by writing, drawing or creating on individual (cloth grommet-lined moop-proof) flags which will be attached to WE. Throughout the week, WE will organically grow and participants can walk amongst and be inspired by this hanging garden that signifies BRC’s collective, shared wisdom. Some pieces in WE will be written in mirror cursive, a homage to Da Vinci’s notebooks--we will provide pocket mirrors to decipher their meaning.
print_description: Add piece of yourself to BRCs collective mind: share your passions, hopes, reflections, experiences in this interactive art installation

title: What are those 5Rhythms anyway? w/Aaron Lifshin
description: Just like light, sound, or ocean waves, a dancing body moving freely passes through five distinct rhythmic patterns. These patterns continuously repeat themselves in a wave of motion. Gabrielle Roth's 5Rhythms® are: FLOWING – the fluid, continuous, grounded glide of our own movements; STACCATO – the percussive, pulsing beat that shapes us a thousand different ways; CHAOS – the rhythm of letting go, releasing into the catalytic wildness of our dance that can never be planned or repeated; LYRICAL – the rhythm of trance, where the weight of self-consciousness dissolves, where we lighten up and disappear into our own uniqueness; and STILLNESS – the quiet emptiness, where gentle movements rise and fall, start and end, in a field of silence. Please join Aaron Lifshin for an introduction to the 5Rhythms movement practice, at RhythmWave.
print_description: Please join Aaron Lifshin for an introduction to the 5Rhythms movement practice, at RhythmWave.

title: What Goes Around, Comes Around
description: Earth Guardians presents the art of Bonnie Monteleone which depicts the abundance of plastic debris in some of the most remote regions of the world.  After logging nearly 10,000 nautical miles in 3 ocean gyres, the word is out: " All of us are part of the problem, but we all can be part of the solution".  Learn about Bonnie's amazing journey
print_description: Bonnie Monteleone's art depicts the abundance of plastic in remote areas of the world. Hear about her amazing journey: 10,000 n. miles, 3 gryres.

title: WHAT IF? Diner
description:
Ignite your child-like wonderment at the “WHAT IF? Diner.” The diner will include a towering 8ft tall Jukebox that will light up and invite you to come closer, dangle your feet at our oversized booth, enjoy some treats, and dance away!

Let your imagination run free, and write in a massive guest book whose cover bears a simple but powerful question: "What if..."

When: 7pm M | 8am W | 7pm Th

Hosted by Camp Whynauts. Our mission is to inspire people to imagine what the world could be like by reconnecting with their sense of child-like wonderment.
print_description:

Unleash your imagination with us!

title: Why Hollywood wants you to get married
description: Consensual non-monogamy heavily questions the traditional paradigm on relationships. But who is the fiercest and most successful advocate of traditional relationships? Hollywood, that since we are kids and throughout our entire life feeds us with happy endings that inevitably evolve around a couple finally being together. In the past few years, though, it seems like Hollywood is considering nontraditional relationships as well. Can we trust the studios, or should we question them?

title: Wild & Risky Cocktail Saloon & Casino Lounge
description:
Pop into the Bang Bang Wild Saloon Cocktail Lounge & Casino. Stroll through on your way out to The Playa, pop in on your way home from a sunrise session. Or Start the day fresh here. Be prepared to enter and RISK something, for every RISK, there is potential REWARD. What to RISK? Something tangible. Something creative. Something material. Something you are prepared to RISK. You decide!

Bigger the RISK leads to Bigger REWARD. Leave a shoe, leave a trinket, leave your pants, leave a love note, leave a bike, leave a song lyric, leave a dance, leave your glasses or leave Burner Fashion. Place it in the secret drawers and Bang Bang's Casino will decide the outcome.

Our giant Casino Games can help you win YOUR item back, or RISK the chance to win something more shiny, However chance loosing it all and see that item be gifted forward to others.

Once you play the Bang Bang Casino Games you drink all day at the Bang Bang Cocktail Bar. Every day a delightful cocktail is curated for your taste buds, there will be music playing at ambient levels to give the saloon atmosphere.

Casino Games: Aussie Two Up, Giant Dice, Human Roulette, Bingo Blitz & Giant Cards

Care not to risk something tangible? No worries mate, you can drink at the bar, everyone is welcome. BUT for every drink you feel like knocking back requires the Non-Riskers to have a spoonful of vegemite... or just harden up and TAKE A RISK, you only live once!
print_description: Dare to risk something tangible. Bigger the risk, bigger the reward. Once you play drink all day. Have a punt a with large Casino games & Cocktails.

title: Wishmaker Temple Offerings
description: Need help with a Temple offering? Wish Maker is a quiet place to create, think, say goodbye, hello, maker affirmations, proclamations of love and anything else you need to burn. We have all the tools and craft supplies you need to fully realize your offering and a place for you to place it when you are done. Visit us Monday through Saturday from 3pm-6pm. We will close down on the day of the Temple burn in order to gather all the offerings that have been created and make sure they make it safely to the heart of the Temple for the Burn. title: Witnessing/Holding Sacred Space
description:
Witnessing/Holding Sacred Space: Adventures in Exhibitionism/Voyeurism. 
Sharing erotic self-touch (Masturbation) as observer and observed.
Bring a towel and a favorite lube.
Many of us received the message that experiencing pleasure – especially erotic pleasure – is wrong. Even when we learn later in life that is good, we can still experience shame. Nothing is better for shame than confronting it. This workshop gives participants the opportunity to alternate roles as exhibitionist and voyeur in groups of three. The voyeurs job is to hold a sacred non-judgmental space for the exhibitionist. The exhibitionists job is to let go of shame and give themselves over to erotic pleasure, knowing they have permission and are supported by their voyeurs.
print_description: Sharing erotic self-touch as observer and observed.

title: World's Largest Fire Blanket
description: Senior Earth Guardian and Leave No Trace Master Educator Mike Bilbo will discuss the history of burn scars on the playa, Leave No Trace solutions, and Burning Man's stewardship through large scale solutions known as burn platforms. We will investigate.

title: WTS Pink lemonade Dive Bar & Games
description: Come One, Come All, Come Party with/like a White Trash Superstar. Our Signature drinks are Vodka Lemonade (no promises on ice)  White trash Mimosas, Tang Bang, and we serve ice cold draft beer, we hardly stop there... Our Bartenders are on Vacay too so they can be nice or they can be snarky! Sometimes drinks are gifted, sometimes they are bartered; but never sold!!! So leave your $$ in your camp, and bring something fun to tip your bartender!!! Please bring a cup that you can pimp out while you wait. We do not operate on any schedule, so the rule of thumb is: If the barstools are down, we are most likely serving drinks, or at least attitude... Some of our games include: Pool, fooseball, tether ball, shuffleboard, white trash horseshoes, and we are excited to introduce nascar inspired drag racing!

title: Yellow Submarine Viewing Party and Sing-A-Long!
description: Do you like to sing? Do you like The Beatles? Step right this way! Roll up for our Mystery Tour! One night only! Wear your grooviest duds that show off your spirit of the 60’s and take a trip in our Yellow Submarine as we gaze upon The Beatles 1968 voyage through Pepperland! Enjoy refreshments while you watch the movie with fellow fans! Harmonize with The Beatles during the movie and attend our after party in our Karaoke sing-a-long!   Come for the movie; stay for the vocal jam. - Some years ago on the Playa, we had a total blast when a spontaneous chorus broke out in our camp, covering classic songs, and an annual tradition was born. We’re updating that tradition as we gather this year to sing timeless Beatles tunes with/without accompaniment. Everyone’s invited and welcomed! It ain’t over ’til it’s over!
print_description: Wear your grooviest 1960s duds! It’s a 1968 Yellow Submarine trip with The Beatles thru Pepperland! Refresh while U view and sing. Karaoke bash after!

title: Yoga Mala: 108 Sun Salutations
description: One to the first power, times two to the second, times three to the third: That's 108, the number of beads on a Buddhist prayer string and the number of sun salutations in this devotional, meditative, and spiritual yoga practice. Come join us at the Man on the day he burns, facing the rising sun on the deep playa side, for some joyful time spent moving our bodies and breathing together. No need to be scared by the number 108! The point is to breathe and to be, and the practice will be scaled to everybody and all bodies, including those that have never done yoga before! Join us to honor a beautiful community and to welcome a beautiful new year. Everybody welcome.
print_description: Come practice a yoga mala: 108 meditative and devotional sun salutations performed at sunrise on the day the Man burns. Scaled to all bodies!
other_location: Just past the Man, towards the rising sun

title: Yogananda Energization and Prayer for World Peace
description: Together let us become “Awake and Ready” with Paramhansa Yogananda’s Energization Exercises & Prayer for world peace.  Prepare your mind and spirit for another uplifting day on the Playa!  Yogananda claimed the purpose of exercise was to awaken an inner energy source.  His series of energization exercises were designed to bring both energy and calm.  The exercises “purify the bloodstream and recharge every cell with cosmic energy.” The aim is to gain increased awareness and control over your life force and to identify more with the soul than the body.  This event happens just before yoga and meditation at Buddha Camp and is a great way to wake up and prepare your body and mind for those sessions.  All the exercises are done from a standing position and anyone, regardless of fitness level, can benefit.  Following the exercises we will repeat together, Yogananda's Peace and Harmony Prayer for World Peace.  This event is 30 minutes long.  Come join us!
print_description: Let us become “Awake and Ready” with Yogananda’s Energization Exercises & Prayer for world peace.  Prepare your mind & spirit for the day!

title: Yogoman @ Reverbia Live Nights
description: Reverbia is proud to return Yogoman to Reverbia Nights Live Main Stage.  Formally known as Yogoman Burning Band…(perhaps the band will re-add the latter of their former name for this one performance in Black Rock City)…this very popular festival headlining band from the NW can and will get Crazy!!!  Front vocalist and Drummer, Jordan Rain, continues to blend profound, with a wee on the silly side, lyrical content…complimenting their constant wiper blade booty shaking, funky/reggae dub beats style…which the band is now so famous for perfecting.  Bellingham hails this band as one of their favorite sons and Yogoman has toured festivals and show venues all across the West Coast...down, down into the Deep South, including their long stints on Bourbon Street in their favorite hub stop of New Orleans.

title: Zipline
description:
Just off of Esplanade, after a death-defying climb up more than fifty feet of chain ladder, watch as someone in a tutu and a cowboy hat clips you into a safety harness and then sends you plummeting in a terrifying freefall directly towards the playa below.

Welcome to the Sextant zipline.
print_description: A thrilling ride from the top of our 70ft tower out more than 1200 feet onto playa.

title: Zip Line!
description: Climb the tower and hold on tight as you zip down the zip line. Ask a Stagger for more information
print_description: Climb the tower and hold on tight as you zip down the zip line. Ask a Stagger for more information

title: Zumba & Salsa
description: Come before class to cool off with an ice cold margarita.  Warm up with zumba by Oracle.  Take a salsa dancing lesson with Oracle and Scott.  Then stick around for Club Si Señor.
print_description: Come before class to cool off with an ice cold margarita.  Warm up with zumba.  Take a salsa dancing lesson.  Then stick around for Club Si Señor.

title: Sunset Cruise Aboard Gracie Pleasurebarge
description: It’s a dance party on top of Camp Salty’s shining starfish ­­Gracie Pleasurebarge. Hop aboard the newly resurrected gem of the sea as we parade through town and playa. DJ sets, salty drinks and dance parties. Daily departures from Camp Salty (9:00 & E) around 6pm
print_description: Daily playa cruises

title: Vegan Oasis
description: A snark-free safe zone for herbivores and those interested in a Vegan lifestyle to connect, share and inspire.
print_description: A snark-free safe zone for herbivores and those interested in a Vegan lifestyle to connect, share and inspire.

title: Vegans vs. Vegetarians vs. Pescatarians Challenge
description: Compete in teams to see who are the sexiest, smartest, and strongest via friendly competitions including best kisser and best mock orgasm to win all you can eat ice cream!
